# Tran Khoi Nguyen Pham (Noah Pham)

## Summary
Tran Khoi Nguyen Pham, also known as Noah Pham, or Pham Tran Khoi Nguyen, is a Computer Science student at the University of Manchester, founder, and software developer based in Manchester, UK. He builds products that solve real problems, focusing on AI-powered applications, voice technology, and developer tools.

## Contact & Links
- Website: https://noahpham.me
- Location: Manchester, United Kingdom

## Current Focus
- Studying Computer Science at University of Manchester
- Building intelligent applications with AI/ML integration
- Hackathon competitor and winner

## Notable Achievements
- 9 times hackathon winner.
- 1st Place, Snap Inc. Challenge at Junction 2025 (Europe's largest hackathon, 1,500+ participants, Helsinki)
- 1st place Reply Challenge, Hackathons UK Challenge Winner, 3rd Place overall at GreatUniHack 2025.
- Multiple hackathon awards and recognitions

## Projects

### SpeakWisely
AI-powered IELTS Speaking preparation platform with instant personalized feedback on pronunciation, fluency, vocabulary, and grammar.
- Live: https://speakwisely.me
- Tech: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Supabase, PostgreSQL, OpenAI, Whisper

### YourWalk (HackJunction 1st Place)
AR safety navigation with Snap Spectacles that visualizes safe zones and provides an agentic AI companion for nighttime walks. Calculates risk scores using crime statistics, lighting levels, and pedestrian activity.
- Tech: Snap Spectacles, Lens Studio, AR, AI Agents, TypeScript

### LeetCoach (StudentHack 2nd Place)
Agentic conversational coding companion for interview preparation. Features voice-enabled AI support, real-time feedback, and secure code execution.
- Tech: Next.js, TypeScript, Python, Gemini, Neuphonic, CodeMirror

## Skills
- Frontend: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
- Backend: Python, Node.js, Supabase, PostgreSQL
- AI/ML: OpenAI, Gemini, Whisper, Voice AI, AI Agents
- Other: AR Development, Docker, Cloudflare, Vercel

## Philosophy
"I build products that solve real problems for real people. The best products feel intuitive, remove friction, and genuinely improve someone's productivity."
